last_episode_to_air.name: The World You See Isn't All There Is

name: GeGeGe no Kitaro
overview: Nearly twenty years into the 21st century, people have forgotten the existence of Yokai. When a number of unexplainable phenomena plague adults of the human world with confusion and chaos, thirteen-year-old Mana writes a letter to the Yokai Post in search of answers, only to be greeted by GeGeGe no Kitaro...

seasons.name: Season 1
seasons.overview: After a vlogger inadvertently unseals dangers from the spirit world, normal Tokyo girl Mana seeks help from yokai boy Kitaro and his eyeball father.

episodes.name: The Day Yokai Awoke
episodes.overview: Kitaro and Medama Oyaji appear before an incredulous student who put a letter into the yokai post after people began to suddenly change into trees.

episodes.name: Terror! Miage-Nyudo
episodes.overview: Kitaro is safe following an attack thanks to Mana. After releasing a yokai from imprisonment, Nezumi Otoko buys a talent agency as part of a plan.

episodes.name: Tantanbo's Yokai Castle
episodes.overview: Kitaro and the others look into a series of child disappearances and notice something they all have in common. Mana visits a construction site.

episodes.name: The Taboo of the Mysterious Forest
episodes.overview: Yuta learns the location of the GeGeGe Forest from Mana, and finds his way in. Excited to be in the yokai world, he gets Kitaro to show him around.

episodes.name: The Disaster of the Electric Yokai
episodes.overview: The lightning-charged yokai Kaminari gets Nezumi Otoko out of trouble and into big profits. But he's tough to control and things soon get out of hand.

episodes.name: The Misfortune of the Sunekosuri
episodes.overview: Kitaro heads to the mountains to take care of a Sunekosuri that's draining the energy of the woman who harbors it. But it thinks it's just a cute cat.

episodes.name: Ghost Train
episodes.overview: A company president drunkenly assaults Kitaro, shouting that the supernatural doesn't exist. Later, karma arrives in the form of an unfamiliar train.

episodes.name: Menace! Kagami-Jijii´s Plot
episodes.overview: On a village visit during a school trip, Mana accidentally knocks over a stone tablet, incurring the attention of a being that appear in mirrors.

episodes.name: The Kappas´ Work Reform
episodes.overview: Ever the entrepreneur, Rat Man pitches his services to a family whose husband is overworked. But he soon finds himself on the end of a different deal.

episodes.name: Vanishing! The Seven School Mysteries
episodes.overview: Cat Girl gets a message telling her that strange things are going on at school. She looks for her supernatural friend Hanako there but can't find her.

episodes.name: Conquer Japan! The 808 Tanuki Army
episodes.overview: When another moon appears in the sky, The 808 Tanuki army claims credit and demands control of Japan. Kitaro heads underground to face them.

episodes.name: Capital Annihilated! The Terrifying Yokai Beast
episodes.overview: Now that Kitaro's been turned to stone, the tanuki move to suppress all anti-tanuki sentiment. Cat Girl introduces Mana to the growing resistance.

episodes.name: The Desired Diamonds! Wanyūdō's Trap
episodes.overview: After Rat Man's diamond business takes off, Kitaro accuses him of foul play and they cut ties. The plot thickens when two men in black suits appear.

episodes.name: Makura-Gaeshi and the Fantastic Dream
episodes.overview: After he's laid off, a desperate salaryman finds refuge in slumber. But after weeks pass and he doesn't wake up, his son asks Kitaro for help.

episodes.name: Zunbera Spirit Surgery
episodes.overview: Kirara hates how her schoolmates stare at her homely face. The witch-like yokai Zunbera offers to make her beautiful, but her help doesn't come cheap.

episodes.name: The Mystery of the Tide! Umizatō
episodes.overview: Mana heads to Sakaiminato and can't wait to attend the local festival. But things go awry when a boat goes missing along with her uncle.

episodes.name: Kani-Bōzu and the Ancient Mystery
episodes.overview: A monk-like yokai challenges those he meets to answer his question and turns those who cannot into stone. Mana and Kitaro's father must save the day.

episodes.name: Kawauso's Lie
episodes.overview: Car Girl takes pity on a hungry boy and secretly gives him some of the vegetables she's been growning. But there's something strange about him.

episodes.name: Ressurected Yōkai?! The Obake School
episodes.overview: Kitaro sneaks into a ghost school that's attracting the attention and attendance of local kids. It seems like a great place but something's off.

episodes.name: Memories of the Yōka
episodes.overview: Mana visits her sick great aunt. When she shows Kitaro the red flower that blooms in her garden, he suspects something supernatural and heads south.

episodes.name: Flame on! The Solitude of the Takurō-Bi
episodes.overview: Rat Man's up to no good again, this time using a fire yokai to power his amusement park attraction. It soon forms an unlikely friendship with a robot.

episodes.name: Berserk!! The Terrifying Yōkai Gyūki
episodes.overview: Kitaro and his friends visit an island where legends tell of an ox demon. There, a television crew coordinated by Rat Man soon sparks a crisis.

episodes.name: The Yōkai Apartment Secret Story
episodes.overview: Natsumi is ready to close down her grandparents' old apartment building when Kitaro appears and asks her to reconsider, telling her about its history.

episodes.name: Nezumi-Otoko's Disappearance?! Sekiyō's Trap
episodes.overview: Rat Man gets married but his beautiful bride quickly takes advantage of him. She's actually a gold-digging yokai and surprisingly tough to stop.

episodes.name: Kubire-Oni's Curse
episodes.overview: Mana installs a pernicious smartphone app that curses the person she names. But the unhappiness she causes soon multiplies, and rebounds back to her.

episodes.name: Glamour! The Beautiful Gahi
episodes.overview: Yuna's mother forbids her to talk to boys. But when she finds a magic picture of a beautiful young man, he comes alive and becomes her companion.

episodes.name: Invasion! Backbeard's Army
episodes.overview: Kitaro and friends accept a number of refugee yokai but cultural differences quickly lead to trouble. The true enemy waits behind the scenes.

episodes.name: The Great Yōkai War
episodes.overview: As the nefarious Backbeard's minions prepare another assault on the Japanese yokai world, Kitaro attempts to destroy the Ring of Arcana.

episodes.name: The Insane Frankenstein
episodes.overview: While looking for the ring, Agnes causes trouble downtown and earns a scolding from Kitaro. But she soon gets a very different reception from Mana.

episodes.name: The Vampire's Halloween Party
episodes.overview: Halloween fever hits Japan but Cat Girl isn't feeling the love. She heads to the movies with Mana, where Carmilla and some vampiric minions await.

episodes.name: Azuki-Arai, Azuki-Hakari, Azuki-Babaa
episodes.overview: The azuki bean yokai trio is bummed because humans don't fear them anymore. Rat Man offers to fix all their problems and make azuki beans great again.

episodes.name: Akuma Belial: The Hundred-Year Grudge
episodes.overview: Mana runs into Kojiro, who still has feelings for her. While trying to look cool he accidentally breaks a sphere, unsealing the demon Belial's power.

episodes.name: The Fox's Wedding and Hakusanbō
episodes.overview: Kitaro meets a wealthy man whose daughter faces kidnapping by a yokai. Meanwhile, Kitaro's foes find a lead in their search for the Ring of Arcana.

episodes.name: Emperor Blackbeard
episodes.overview: Kitaro's friends usually take an annual vacation together, but this year's trip is cancelled when members of the group begin to disappear one-by-one.

episodes.name: The Witches of Destiny
episodes.overview: Fearful of attracting harm to her Japanese friends from Backbeard, Agnes says farewell. But Mana's won't let go of their relationship so easily.

episodes.name: The Transform All Japanese Yokai Project
episodes.overview: Adele and Agnes race to see who will find the ring first but it winds up on Mana's finger, sticking her in the center of a dramatic magical battle.

episodes.name: Decisive Battle!! Backbeard
episodes.overview: One human who survives Backbeard's Brigadoon accepts the help of a former foe and must risk everything to save Kitaro and the rest of humanity.

episodes.name: New Year's Cannibal Mystery Kasha
episodes.overview: After a long hiatus, a corpse-stealing yokai is again spotted trying to bring a body home to eat. Weak with age, he must try new tactics to succeed.

episodes.name: Yuki-Onna Snow White Love Report
episodes.overview: Feverishly in love, Shun confesses his feelings for Yuki-Onna. The two start dating, but it all goes sour after Shun seeks love advice from Rat Man.

episodes.name: The Final Ballad: Sara-Kozō
episodes.overview: Entertainer Bimbo Isamu decides to deal with his faded career by risking the wrath of the yokai Sara Kozo and stealing his signature chant.

episodes.name: Enigma! Bake-Zōri's Rebellion
episodes.overview: After their owner moves away, the yokai-possessed belongings he left behind get very upset. Rat Man manipulates the situation to his advantage.

episodes.name: Momon-Jii's Scheme: The Great Yōkai Trial
episodes.overview: The tengu arrest Kitaro for an arcane yokai crime. There's a mountain of evidence against him, so much that his friends suspect the trial's a set-up.

episodes.name: Eternal Life: Odoro-Odoro
episodes.overview: While investigating a series of vampiric incidents, Kitaro receives a letter from a scientist who claims to have found the secret to immortality.

episodes.name: Masquerade Nopperabō
episodes.overview: Aspiring celebrity Atsushi struggles to maintain his playboy act since he's actually a nerd. He gets support from a mysterious online friend.

episodes.name: The Truth Lies in the Thicket of the Mannen-Dake
episodes.overview: Kitaro and his friends head into a bamboo thicket infamous for a yokai that supposedly leads those who enter astray. A chilling greeting awaits them.

episodes.name: The Void of Despair and Darkness
Messenger From the Underworld Nue
episodes.overview: Kitaro heads to a village where people are suffering from an unknown ailment. Cat Girl insists on accompanying him but she's still not back to normal.

episodes.name: Enma-Diao's Secret Bargain
episodes.overview: Giant Nue appears above Tokyo, menacing the city and causing chaos. Kitaro heads down to Hell to strike an ambitious deal with King Enma.

episodes.name: Runaway Girl! The Forest of the Kinoko
episodes.overview: Mana's friend Miyabi wishes she didn't have to study or do chores. She soon meets the 'Tree Children,' who give her more than she bargained for.

episodes.name: Narcissism Overload! Nuke-Kubi's Close Call!
episodes.overview: Vlogger Charatomi's frustration with job interviews leads him to pair up with insecure yokai Nukekubi. But their plan sparks an unfortunate reaction.

episodes.name: Dorotabo, life and Earth
episodes.overview: A tormented farmer's spirit takes the monstrous form of a giant yokai nightly. Kitaro recognizes it as the same yokai from an incident 30 years ago.

episodes.name: Hihi's Harassment Hell
episodes.overview: Tennis playing yokai Hihi wants to train a human to win the gold medal. His training methods are effective but extreme, forcing Kitaro to intervene.

episodes.name: The Bewitching Melody Elite the Vampire
episodes.overview: Frustrated after Kitaro rejects his avaricious nature, Rat Man finds a vampiric companion who appreciates his material desires and wants his help.

episodes.name: The Bloody Noble La Siene
episodes.overview: Agnes informs Kitaro that recent blood-sucking incidents don't just involve vampires; they're connected to the resurgence of their old foe, Backbeard.

episodes.name: The Han-Gyojin's Strange Kamaboko Tale
episodes.overview: While investigating ship-related incidents, Kitaro runs into the ever-mercurial Rat Man, who leads him right into the clutches of a familiar foe.

episodes.name: Promise to The Female Yokai Ushirogami
episodes.overview: After receiving a disturbing message, Mana goes to check on a friend but finds her missing. A mysterious cactus seems to be connected to the incident.

episodes.name: Pitch-Black Coldness The Yokai Buru-Buru
episodes.overview: Mana, Yuta, Hiroto, and Soma head out camping. The older boys tease Yuta for being a scaredy-cat, but a sudden chill soon has them all spooked.

episodes.name: Tofu-Kozo's Mold Pandemic
episodes.overview: Despondent singer Kana Nickel meets a tofu-carrying yokai. After she discovers that, like her, he lacks a sense of purpose, she makes him her manager.

episodes.name: The Four Generals of the Underworld Kurobozu's Trap
episodes.overview: Panic ensues after polluted water appears at the site of a newly constructed dam. Kitaro suspects it's the work of the powerful yokai Kurobozu.

episodes.name: The Star Festival of Love The Yokai Flower
episodes.overview: Rat Man asks Kitaro for help with Seika, a yokai who uses bamboo to harass humans. Kitaro soon discovers there's another side to Seika's actions.

episodes.name: The Heart's Darkness the Suiko Reflects
episodes.overview: Unable to withstand any more bullying from her husband's sadistic boss, Shoko snaps and turns to the destructive powers of Suiko the tiger yokai.

episodes.name: Nation Founding Mabyo's Great Tottori Empire
episodes.overview: In a bizarre play to liven up Tottori Prefecture, its governor secedes from Japan. When Kitaro and his friends question why, the police arrest them.

episodes.name: The Shinigami and Sakaiminato's Hidden Village
episodes.overview: At a summer festival, Mana follows a strange voice that leads her out of sight. Her friends try to follow but the macabre yokai Shinigami interferes.

episodes.name: The Social Media Addict Versus The Jomon Man
episodes.overview: Rat Man builds an online following using photos of his new pal, a primitive caveman, sparking a battle for Likes with Mana's friend, Christine.

episodes.name: Capital Punishment! Exiled to the Underworld
episodes.overview: After crashing his stolen car, a criminal gets a ride with a strange chauffeur by the name of Kitaro, who says he'll take him to 'where he belongs.'

episodes.name: General of the Underworld The Kido, Ibukimaru
episodes.overview: A strange young man warns Mana that her association with yokai imperils her life. Later, General Ibukimaru of the underworld takes a human hostage.

episodes.name: Spirit Affliction Mysterious Footprints
episodes.overview: Hoping to choose his own path in life, a young man plans to destroy a sacred rock his family has guarded for generations. He finds Kitaro in his way.

episodes.name: Karakasa's Umbrella Troubles
episodes.overview: Karakasa is shocked at how folk treat their umbrellas these days. When he sees a man mistakenly take the wrong one, it starts a wild goose chase.

episodes.name: Iyami the yokai's great love project
episodes.overview: After meeting an eccentric, love-obsessed yokai, Kitaro uncharacteristically asks Cat Girl on a date. Their friends smell a rat and tail the couple.

episodes.name: The Yamata-no-Orochi of Greed
episodes.overview: A selfish salaryman follows rumors of a wish-granting dragon and learns that it is real. But so are the tragic consequences of his avaricious wishes.

episodes.name: The Fall of the Underworld ?! Tamamo-no-Mae's Trap
episodes.overview: Enma demands Kitaro help him find a treasonous general or risk losing his freedom. Meanwhile, Rei Isurugi hatches a destructive plan to gain power.

episodes.name: Kyubi no Kitsune
episodes.overview: Rei insists he'll never give up, even as his body struggles under the burden of so many souls. Meanwhile, Tamamo-no-Mae lays waste to Hell.

episodes.name: Nurahiyon's Ambition
episodes.overview: Hell is back to normal but the culprit who unleashed the Generals remains at large. Meanwhile, a familiar yokai makes trouble at a construction site.

episodes.name: Vanishing Humans! Neko-Sennin's Revenge
episodes.overview: Kitaro senses that Nurarihyon is using violence to pit humans against each other and goes looking for him. But as always, his foe is one step ahead.

episodes.name: The Moryo of Mukuro Village
episodes.overview: Kitaro enters a cursed village to investigate the ties between a death-obsessed photographer and the Moryo, a corpse-dwelling yokai who's after him.

episodes.name: Komori-Neko's Halloween Pandemonium
episodes.overview: One spooky Halloween night, Backbeard's minion Komori Neko begs Rat Man to help him climb the ranks. Naturally, Rat Man agrees to help -- for a price.

episodes.name: Onmoraki's Trap
episodes.overview: After Mana notices her classmate Tsutomu acting like a zombie, she follows him home and spots someone acting even stranger. Kitaro decides to step in.

episodes.name: Hot Blooded Manga Artist: The Yōkai Hiderigami
episodes.overview: Cyclopic yokai Hiderigami has trouble breaking into the human comic business. Even when he finds a willing editor, Kitaro worries it won't end well.

episodes.name: Geriatric Nuppeppo
episodes.overview: After Rat Man gets rich from an anti-aging cream with a nasty effect, Kitaro follows a trail from the cream to the mysterious Nuppeppo yokai.

episodes.name: Chain of Hatred The Yōkai Hōkō
episodes.overview: Claiming to be looking for “Takumi,” a masked yokai begins assaulting humans. The attacks seem random but Kitaro finds a connection to a certain tree.

episodes.name: Chin-san, the Foreign Worker
episodes.overview: A peculiar yokai from southern lands comes to Japan for work, but his lack of familiarity with clothing causes trouble. Kitaro steps in to assist.

episodes.name: The Giant, Daidarabotchi
episodes.overview: After Rat Man witnesses a dark ceremony, the appearance of giant eyeballs over Kofu leads a yokai expert to pronounce the return of Daidarabotchi.

episodes.name: Bloody Christmas
episodes.overview: Mana's Christmas shopping trip is ruined when she runs into a strange being dressed as Santa who's been snatching kids off the street.

episodes.name: The Binbogami and The Zashiki-Warashi
episodes.overview: Mana visits her friend's family-run cafe and is impressed at how good the food is. But the place is empty, except for one suspicious-looking old man

episodes.name: Rollo Cloth's Romance
episodes.overview: After his beloved singer rejects him, Ittan Momen's hurt feelings lead him to Rat Man's newest venture: a house shared by yokai and cute young women.

episodes.name: The Curse of Te-no-Me
episodes.overview: Visions of a strange man with eyes in his hands cause chaos in the legal world as Nurarihyon reveals a plot to pass a sweeping law against yokai.

episodes.name: Idol Legend Sazae-Oni
episodes.overview: When a video of Kitaro singing about mermaids becomes a hit, his friends are all shocked. They're even more shocked when he reveals it's not him.

episodes.name: The Misty Night of Angkor Wat
episodes.overview: Years after the two witness a tragic supernatural event at Angkor Wat, a famous director invites Kitaro to his new play to try and achieve closure.

episodes.name: The Writer is Ama-no-Jaku
episodes.overview: Desperate for new ideas for a show, a television director follows Rat Man to a hole in the woods, where the happiness-hating yokai Amanojaku awaits.

episodes.name: The Phantom Train
episodes.overview: After everyone else in the world is transformed into vampires, Cat Girl and Kitaro's dad race to find a phantom train to travel back to the past.

episodes.name: The Lazy Fujimi Hot Springs Bus Trip
episodes.overview: Mana joins her yokai friends on a trip to a hot spring inn. But its owner has a request for her and Kitaro that leads them into an old foe's trap.

episodes.name: The Great Yokai Alliance
episodes.overview: Forming a cold-blooded yokai alliance, Backbeard and Nurarihyon declare war on humanity. The government reacts by passing a strict anti-yokai law.

episodes.name: The Second Great Yokai War
episodes.overview: The bad guys toast their impending victory. Cat Girl says it's her turn to save the day and takes Mana with her to the underworld to confront Enma.

episodes.name: The World You See Isn't All There Is

1.name: Season 1
1.overview: After a vlogger inadvertently unseals dangers from the spirit world, normal Tokyo girl Mana seeks help from yokai boy Kitaro and his eyeball father.
